page.title: 20ST OUEN'S BAY (NORTHERN END)
page.content:
This bay is the largest in Jersey and is five miles long approximately. A lot of activities are held on the beach including sand racing, with motor cars and motorcycles, and water sports. The most popular activity at the northern end is swimming. Some surfing also takes place.
Swimmers are helped by being shown where it is safe to swim because the safer areas are marked by two flags. These flags are red and yellow. The area between the flags is watched all the time by the beachguards and they rescue people who get into difficulties.
When it is too dangerous to swim the beachguards put up a red warning flag and advise people not to go into the water.
